column4: guys, can anyone please tell me what this error is from ? http://img714.imageshack.us/img714/1277/err1.jpg running ubuntu 10.04.1 64bit
that's a kernel panic it looks like
could this be because of hdd or ram failure ? or what causes panics like this usually ?
kernel panics are often either broken hardware or broken drivers
memtest is available from the grub boot menu
it will usually be near the bottom, after the kernel boot options, with a name like Memory test (memtest86+)
you can check for filesystem corruption somewhat using smart, assuming your motherboard supports it
err, hdd corruption
as for drivers, are you running any proprietary blob drivers?
S.M.A.R.T., I mean. It's something that does diagnostics on hard drives
it can be controlled through ubuntu's smart daemon
if you didn't add any drivers in the after-install process, you won't be
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Smartmontools
I use it only as a server, no fancy video drivers, sound, etc. so only the default install stuff
hmm, in that case it's highly unlikely that it's a driver error
I have SMART support
if I run smartctl, will it disrupt the server's activity ?
while you're running a test on the drive, it may slighly decrease read/write performance on that drive
but it doesn't require any special treatment
and one last question, if it's a raid1, can I safely run the test on sda and sdb individually, one after another ?
sorry, yeah, it should be fine
smart is on a much lower level than software raid
